channel.title: Stockwatch - Key Events
channel.description: Real-time corporate announcements, deals, and financial results.

item.title: [FAZE3Q] Faze Three Ltd Releases Limited Review Report for Q3 and Nine Months Ended December 31, 2025
item.description:
Faze Three Ltd, a home textiles manufacturer and exporter, has released the Limited Review Report for the quarter and nine months ended December 31, 2025. The report, issued by M/s. MSKA & Associates LLP, the Statutory Auditors of the Company, is in compliance with the Regulations 33 of the SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015. The Company's revenue from operations stands at INR 621.84 crores for the year ended December 31, 2025.

  • Faze Three Ltd released the Limited Review Report for the quarter and nine months ended December 31, 2025.
  • The report is issued by M/s. MSKA & Associates LLP, the Statutory Auditors of the Company.
  • The Company's revenue from operations stands at INR 621.84 crores for the year ended December 31, 2025.
  • The report is in compliance with the Regulations 33 of the SEBI (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015.
  • Faze Three Ltd is a home textiles manufacturer and exporter.

item.title: [ZENSARTECH] Zensar Technologies Secures $210 Million Framework Deal with Major Financial Player
item.description:
ðŸ”¥ Trending

Zensar Technologies, a leading experience, engineering, and engagement technology solutions company, secured a large 5.5-year framework deal with an expected revenue of $210 million from a large financial company. The deal aims to rethink how work is done and delivered across the enterprise, leveraging AI-led automation to unlock efficiencies.

  • Zensar Technologies secured a $210 million framework deal with a major player in the financial industry.
  • The deal is expected to last for 5.5 years, demonstrating a long-term partnership.
  • The deal aims to rethink and unlock efficiencies across the enterprise using AI-led automation.
  • Zensar Technologies is a leading experience, engineering, and engagement technology solutions company.
  • The partnership is a significant milestone for Zensar, moving beyond traditional modernization and furthering their client's evolution into a true AI-native enterprise.

Company: ZENSAR TECHNOLOGIES LTD. | Category: New Launch

item.title: [SADBHIN] Sadbhav Infrastructure Project Ltd. Announces Q3 and Nine Months Results for 2025, Reports Loss and Legal Disputes
item.description:
Sadbhav Infrastructure Project Limited announced its standalone and consolidated unaudited financial results for the quarter and nine months ended on 31st December 2025. The company reported a loss of INR 1,199.67 crore for the quarter and INR 1,569.29 crore for the nine-month period. Legal disputes with the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) over toll collection suspension and termination of concession agreements are ongoing, with a total claim amount of INR 19,379.20 Million and INR 19,287.10 Million for two subsidiaries, Rohtak Panipat Tollway Private Limited (RPTPL) and Rohtak Hissar Tollway Private Limited (RHTPL) respectively. The company has not made any provision for impairment in the carrying value of investments, subordinate debts, loans, and advances for both subsidiaries.

  • Sadbhav Infrastructure Project Limited reported a loss of INR 1,199.67 crore for Q3 and INR 1,569.29 crore for the nine-month period ended on 31st December 2025.
  • Legal disputes with NHAI over toll collection suspension and termination of concession agreements are ongoing for two subsidiaries, RPTPL and RHTPL.
  • The company has claimed a total of INR 19,379.20 Million and INR 19,287.10 Million from NHAI for RPTPL and RHTPL respectively.
  • No provision has been made for impairment in the carrying value of investments, subordinate debts, loans, and advances for both subsidiaries.
  • The dispute with NHAI over negative Finished Road Level (FRL) has been settled through the Vivad se Vishwas II Scheme of Govt. of India for a net settlement amount of about INR. 650 millions.

ðŸ“„ Read Official Filing (PDF)


Company: Sadbhav Infrastructure Project Ltd | Category: Quarterly Result

item.title: [SADBHIN] Sadbhav Infrastructure Project Ltd. Pays Fine Imposed by Stock Exchange and Ensures Compliance
item.description:
The Board of Directors of Sadbhav Infrastructure Project Ltd. discussed the matter of non-compliance with the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015 in its meeting held on February 12, 2026. The company has already paid the fines imposed by the National Stock Exchange of India Ltd. and BSE Ltd. Following the appointment of Mr. Siddharth Vyas as non-executive director and Mr. Kedar Pandya as company secretary and compliance officer, the company has ensured compliances under the said regulations.

  • Sadbhav Infrastructure Project Ltd. paid fines imposed by the National Stock Exchange of India Ltd. and BSE Ltd.
  • The company ensured compliances under the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Listing Obligations and Disclosure Requirements) Regulations, 2015.
  • Mr. Siddharth Vyas appointed as non-executive director and Mr. Kedar Pandya as company secretary and compliance officer.

ðŸ“„ Read Official Filing (PDF)


Company: Sadbhav Infrastructure Project Ltd | Category: Legal

item.title: [AAYUSH] Aayush Wellness Ltd Announces Q3 and Nine-Months Results for 2025, Revenue from Operations Increases
item.description:
Aayush Wellness Ltd has announced its unaudited standalone and consolidated financial results for the quarter and nine months ended on December 31, 2025. The company's revenue from operations has increased for the quarter and year to date. The board of directors has approved the financial results in a meeting held on February 12, 2026. The company's statement of unaudited financial results is prepared in accordance with Indian Accounting Standard 34 and other accounting principles generally accepted in India.

  • Revenue from operations for the quarter and year to date has increased
  • The unaudited standalone and consolidated financial results for the quarter and nine months ended on December 31, 2025 have been approved by the board of directors
  • The statement of unaudited financial results is prepared in accordance with Indian Accounting Standard 34 and other accounting principles generally accepted in India

Company: Aayush Food and Herbs Ltd | Category: Quarterly Result

item.title: [AAYUSH] Aayush Wellness Ltd Reports Q3 and Nine Months Financial Results for 2025
item.description:
Aayush Wellness Ltd has announced its financial results for the quarter and nine months ended 31 December 2025. The company's revenue from operations for the quarter and period ended December 31, 2025 includes revenue arising from trading in shares and securities. The board has approved the unaudited standalone and consolidated financial results. The company's total income stands at Rs. 4,516.19 lakhs for the quarter and Rs. 10,705.27 lakhs for the nine months ended December 31, 2025.

  • Revenue from operations for the quarter and period ended December 31, 2025 includes revenue arising from trading in shares and securities.
  • The board has approved the unaudited standalone and consolidated financial results.
  • Total income stands at Rs. 4,516.19 lakhs for the quarter and Rs. 10,705.27 lakhs for the nine months ended December 31, 2025.

item.title: [FRONTSP] Frontier Springs Ltd: Delay in Q3,9M Financial Results Due to Auditor's Non-receipt of Limited Review Report
item.description:
Frontier Springs Ltd has delayed the release of its financial results for the quarter and nine months ended December 31, 2025 due to the non-receipt of a Limited Review Report by the auditor. The delay is attributed to the website of the Institute of Chartered Accountants of India not working, preventing the generation of UDIN. The Board of Directors approved the un-audited financial results in a meeting on February 12, 2026. The company is forwarding the unaudited financial results and the limited review report for the quarter ended December 31, 2025.

  • Delay in Q3,9M financial results due to non-receipt of Limited Review Report from the auditor
  • The delay is due to the website of the Institute of Chartered Accountants of India not working, preventing UDIN generation
  • Un-audited financial results for Q3,9M ended December 31, 2025 approved in a Board meeting on February 12, 2026
  • Frontier Springs Ltd forwarding unaudited financial results and limited review report for Q4 2025
  • Meeting commenced at 12:45 p.m. and concluded at 3:35 p.m.

ðŸ“„ Read Official Filing (PDF)


Company: FRONTIER SPRINGS LTD. | Category: Quarterly Result

item.title: [WATERBASE] Waterbase Ltd Announces Leadership Realignment: Ramakanth V. Akula to be Managing Director, Chola Varma Alluri to be Chief Executive Officer
item.description:
Waterbase Ltd, a leading company in its industry, has announced a leadership realignment effective April 1, 2026. The company's current Whole-Time Director & Chief Executive Officer, Ramakanth V. Akula, will transition to the role of Managing Director. He will focus on strategic direction, capital allocation, stakeholder engagement, and long-term growth initiatives. Chola Varma Alluri, currently the Chief Operating Officer, will be elevated to Chief Executive Officer. He will be responsible for the overall management and day-to-day operations of the Company.

  • Ramakanth V. Akula to transition to Managing Director role
  • Chola Varma Alluri to be appointed as Chief Executive Officer
  • Leadership realignment to enhance executive focus, governance structure, and scalability
  • Akula to focus on strategic direction and long-term growth
  • Alluri to oversee operational excellence and execution across business verticals

ðŸ“„ Read Official Filing (PDF)


Company: WATERBASE LTD. | Category: Leadership Update

item.title: [TINNATFL] Fratelli Vineyards Ltd Appoints Sanjay Kumar Jain as Additional Director, Reports Q3&9MFY26 Financial Results
item.description:

item.title: [PERSISTENT] Persistent Systems Ltd Appoints Vikram Tulsyan as Senior Vice President and Senior Management Personnel
item.description:
Persistent Systems Ltd has appointed Mr. Vikram Tulsyan as the Senior Vice President (VP) and Senior Management Personnel (SMP) with effect from Thursday, February 12, 2026 (EST). Mr. Tulsyan is a seasoned finance professional with over 20 years of experience, including 6 years in senior leadership roles. His core expertise includes business finance strategy, P&L management, Financial Planning & Analysis, cost management, and financial governance. He brings deep experience in strategic deal structuring, commercial negotiations, global billing and taxation, and oversight of large capex and vendor procurements. This appointment is in line with the company's commitment to strengthen its leadership and financial strategy.

  • Persistent Systems Ltd appoints Vikram Tulsyan as Senior Vice President and Senior Management Personnel
  • Mr. Tulsyan is a seasoned finance professional with over 20 years of experience
  • His core expertise includes business finance strategy, P&L management, and financial governance
  • He brings deep experience in strategic deal structuring and commercial negotiations
  • This appointment is in line with the company's commitment to strengthen its leadership and financial strategy
